page.title: 04Scenic Beauty-Tamar Valley
page.content: Today the Tamar Valley is very peaceful and quiet. When you walk down beside the river the bank is teeming with wild life. One side of the Tamar Valley is steeply wooded and makes a lovely scene, especially with the big rock in the middle which we call Chimney Rock. As you walk down the river you can listen to all the sounds around,like the song of the birds, the wind in the trees and perhaps the jumping of a fish. Down beside the river you might see salmon fishermen. About a hundred years ago it was very different because it was a very busy mining area. It was noisy, smoky and many more people were around.There were a lot of sailing barges on the river transporting coal, horse manure, limestone and mineral ores. Nowadays you can see the ruins of limekilns and brickworks covered in brambles.
